txt.en:
'The Orcs will not be able to make war upon us today, which is good. It allows us a moment of respite, though only a brief moment. They will have more catapults and siege-weapons built within days, and more siege-masters will pour out from the deeps.

'There is only one way to put an end to this camp. There is an Orc, Lûrkh, who is a master weapon-wright. It is his guiding hand that has made or directed all of the siege-weapons you have seen.

'Return to Drû-garmadh, to the south-east, and defeat Lûrkh. It is the only way the Dale will be safe.'

'This is a joyous day, indeed! With Lûrkh defeated, the making of siege-weapons has come to a halt. Now our foothold here and the outskirts of Lothlórien are both safe from serious threat--though I daresay the Elves would not tolerate Orcs on their borders.'
'I feel we have only delayed the Orcs. In order to truly put an end to this operation, we will need to destroy the mastermind behind the weapons.'
'The Orcs will have a hard time recovering from the loss of their chief builder.'
The dwarves do not believe the threat of the siege-camp will be silenced until the Orc-wright making the weapons is defeated.
Lûrkh is at Drû-garmadh to the south-east of Mekhem-bizru.\n\nDagfari does not believe the siege-weapons will stop until their mastermind, Lûrkh, has been defeated.
Dagfari is at Mekhem-bizru, north-west of Drû-garmadh.\n\nDagfari will want to hear of the defeat of Lûrkh and the end of the siege-camp.
